body_html: I don't think adding a lift operator is a good idea. They work well in Haskell, because the compiler can inline the function (calling a Py function for each elem will be super costly - see map_) + it has a strong type system, so it can check if it has the right signature. It seems to me that it's going to be very easy to give it an incompatible one.
body_text: I don't think adding a lift operator is a good idea. They work well in Haskell, because the compiler can inline the function (calling a Py function for each elem will be super costly - see map_) + it has a strong type system, so it can check if it has the right signature. body: I don't think adding a lift operator is a good idea. They work well in Haskell, because the compiler can inline the function (calling a Py function for each elem will be super costly - see `map_`) + it has a strong type system, so it can check if it has the right signature. It seems to me that it's going to be very easy to give it an incompatible one.
